alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Bryan; Coal; Johnston (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued February 21 at 8:51PM CST until February 22 at 2:00AM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CST FOR SOUTHEASTERN JOHNSTON...NORTHWESTERN BRYAN...SOUTHEASTERN COAL AND ATOKA COUNTIES... At 850 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles east of Wapanucka to near Nida, moving east at 55 mph. Damaging winds are expected. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Durant, Atoka, Caddo, Wapanucka, Stringtown, Lehigh, Silo, Milburn, Tushka, Caney, Kenefic, Mead, Armstrong, Fillmore, Lane, Coleman, Daisy, Nida, northeastern Lake Texoma and Phillips. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are capable of producing widespread wind damage near and east of Nida and Boggy Depot State Park. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
